definitions.definition: To move slowly, especially pushed by currents of water, air, etc.
definitions.example: The balloon was drifting in the breeze.

definitions.definition: To move haphazardly without any destination.
definitions.example: He drifted from town to town, never settling down.

definitions.definition: To deviate gently from the intended direction of travel.
definitions.example: This car tends to drift left at high speeds.

definitions.definition: To drive or carry, as currents do a floating body.

definitions.example: A current of wind drifts snow or sand

definitions.definition: To accumulate in heaps by the force of wind; to be driven into heaps.
To make a drift; to examine a vein or ledge for the purpose of ascertaining the presence of metals or ores; to follow a vein; to prospect.
To enlarge or shape, as a hole, with a drift.
To oversteer a vehicle, causing loss of traction, while maintaining control from entry to exit of a corner. See Drifting (motorsport).
